subject: AI & Agents
title: Copilots vs Autopilots: Two AI Product Patterns
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Copilots vs Autopilots: Two AI Product Patterns.

hook.text: A copilot suggests. An autopilot acts. The choice changes everything about your product.

buildup.text: Copilot pattern: AI assists the human who makes the final decision (e.g., GitHub Copilot).

discovery.text: Autopilot pattern: AI acts autonomously with human oversight only on exceptions (e.g., spam filters).

twist.text: Users trust copilots faster because they stay in control. Autopilots need higher accuracy to earn trust.

climax.text: Start as copilot. Earn trust. Graduate to autopilot as accuracy and confidence grow.

punchline.text: Assist first. Automate later. Trust is the bridge.

quiz.question: Why do copilot-pattern AI products earn trust faster?
options: Users stay in control and make the final decision
